Key Arguments: The legislation threatens freedom of speech, allowing it only for proponents of the bill.
The bill is perceived as an attempt to control public thought and stifle critical examination of government proposals.
Current institutions and the Constitution are deemed sufficient for maintaining law and order without the need for this legislation.
Notable Quotes: I refuse to be part of the 'thought police' agenda.
Truth means a lot to me and those proposing this Bill seem to be afraid of critical examination of their future proposals and agendas in order to control the populace.
